newsitem.title: LUXEMBOURG: Middle East set to lead C'Lux rate rises.
newsitem.headline: Middle East set to lead C'Lux rate rises.

text.p: The Middle East and in particular, the Persian Gulf, would probably attract the biggest increases when Cargolux adjusted its ex-Europe tariffs from early autumn, the all-cargo airline told Reuters.

"The smallest of what will be across-the-board increases will not be below ten percent," Pierre Wesner, Cargolux' vice-president, Europe/Africa/Middle East, said. They are likely to take place either from September 15 or October 1.
The Middle East would top the rate increases scale just ahead of the Far East, the U.S. and South America.

On Middle East rises Wesner said: "One must bear in mind that our ex-Europe rates to this region have been at a relatively low level for some time and it is perhaps more accurate to speak of a correction in rates than increases."
The destinations concerned would include Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Kuwait City and Pakistan, he added.

Three weeks ago, Wesner said very favourable market conditions and a rising dollar pointed the way to significant rates increases in the Autumn. Strong demand everywhere had produced a squeeze on capacity while the strengthening dollar had put pressure on costs.
- Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+ 44 171 542 7706 Fax +5017
